title: Drawing, "Reconciliation of enemies in Italy by the Emperor Henry VII", 1825–50
medium: Graphite, brush and bistre on paper
inscribed: Below: "Carlo VII. Imperatore in Italia per sedare le fazioni che dividevanla."
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: In a big crowded hall, the Emperor sits enthroned upon in the center. In the foreground at left and at right are two groups of men expressing their readiness for reconciliation. Three framing lines, in the inner framing strip below, inside which the caption is written, in ink: "Carlo VII. Imperatore in Italia per sedare le fazioni che dividevanla."

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Reconciliation of enemies in Italy by the Emperor Henry VII", 1825–50.
1825–50. Graphite, brush and bistre on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-545.
